books.title: Captain Blood
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An English doctor is caught up in a rebellion and sentenced to transportation to the Caribbean, but later escapes slavery to become a pirate.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Indian Fairy Tales
books.author: Joseph Jacobs
books.summary: A collection of fairy tales that exhibits India’s rich folk tale tradition.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: The Merry Wives of Windsor
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Sir John Falstaff runs astray of the denizens of Windsor by trying to seduce several local wives at once.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: The Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: To prevent the passage of a controversial government bill, four vigilantes take the law into their own hands.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: Monsieur Lecoq
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: Monsieur Lecoq’s first case in which he tries to determine the identity of a man in custody for three murders.

books.title: The Economic Consequences of the Peace
books.author: John Maynard Keynes
books.summary: Keynes presents a first-hand account of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference and an analysis of the resulting Versailles treaty.

books.title: Tusculan Disputations
books.author: Cicero
books.summary: Cicero gives practical guidance for living wisely and well by adopting a Stoic outlook and concentrating on the virtues.

books.title: The Columbiad
books.author: Joel Barlow
books.summary: Columbus is shown a history of the western hemisphere since his discoveries.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: The Defiant Agents
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: Rival colonies are stranded on an alien world, their memories mixed with those of their ancestors and pitted against each other by the Western and Soviet forces who sent them.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
